greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Triangle relating to ordered Bell numbers, A000670.
comment: A000670 is the eigensequence of triangle A074909, deleting the first "1".
Triangle A074909 is the "beheaded" Pascal's triangle: (1; 1,2; 1,3,3;...).
formula: As infinite lower triangular matrices, A074909 * A000670 as the main diagonal and the rest zeros.
example: Row 4 (nonzero terms) = (1, 4, 18, 52) = termwise product of (1, 4, 6, 4) and (1, 1, 3, 13).
First few rows of the triangle:
mathematica: Table[a[n, k], {n, 1, 10}, {k, 0, n - 1}] // Flatten (* _Jean-François Alcover_, Mar 30 2016 *)
results.author: _Gary W. Adamson_, Mar 05 2012
